name: defilement
content:

the action of spoiling something or someone so that that thing or person is less beautiful or pure: People were furious at this defilement of the countryside. Nobody could prevent this defilement of sacred ground. See
defile
More examplesFewer examplesA Buddhist practitioner tries to purify his mind of all kinds of defilement. He disapproved of autopsies, which he considered a defilement of the dead.The allegations involved the defilement of children.
